content.raw:
I targeted to default because it's likely not ABI compatible since I changed the `pssmSetup` type in header. I had to use a shared pointer to keep ownership of the shadow camera and prevent it from being deleted.

For 1.9, we can do a workaround by doing a `new Ogre::PSSMShadowCameraSetup()` every time. It'll fix the problem but not ideal, and we should not merge it back to default.

I targeted to default because it's likely not ABI compatible since I changed the pssmSetup type in header. I had to use a shared pointer to keep ownership of the shadow camera and prevent it from being deleted.

For 1.9, we can do a workaround by doing a new Ogre::PSSMShadowCameraSetup() every time. It'll fix the problem but not ideal, and we should not merge it back to default.
